action.content:
You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is: Put the potted plant in the cupboard, the orange on the table and the book on the shelf.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a pantry now. There are a banana, a apple, a peach, a orange, a sandwich, a refrigerator and a freezer. The banana is in the refrigerator. The apple is in the refrigerator. The peach is in the refrigerator. The orange is in the refrigerator. The sandwich is in the refrigerator. The refrigerator is closed. The freezer is closed. There is a passage to a kitchen here.
action.label: context

action.content: > take orange from refrigerator
action.label: response
